meanings.definition: The study of the physical and biological aspects of the ocean.
meanings.sent1: Oceanographies help us understand the ocean's living creatures and environment.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use oceanographies to explore marine life and ocean conditions.
meanings.sent3: The oceanographies class had a field trip to observe sea creatures up close.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for oceanographies was like a deep dive into the mysteries of the sea.
meanings.sent5: Through oceanographies, we dive into the secrets of the underwater world.

meanings.definition: The scientific study of oceans and their phenomena.
meanings.sent1: Studying oceanographies involves researching ocean processes and phenomena.
meanings.sent2: Oceanographies provide insights into the mysteries of the deep blue sea.
meanings.sent3: The professor's enthusiasm for oceanographies was contagious among students.
meanings.sent4: Exploring oceanographies is like unraveling the secrets of the vast waters.
meanings.sent5: In the world of oceanographies, every wave tells a story of nature's wonders.

meanings.definition: The branch of science that deals with the physical and biological aspects of the oceans.
meanings.sent1: Oceanographies combine biology and physics to study the ocean's wonders.
meanings.sent2: Researchers in oceanographies work to protect marine life and ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The oceanographies department organized a beach cleanup to protect marine habitats.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to oceanographies was as deep as the ocean itself.
meanings.sent5: Through oceanographies, we explore the intricate balance of life beneath the waves.
